intro: Hieracium commune, commonly known as common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are usually shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium commune is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes and seeds.
